    • SingleSelectDropDownBasedonIndex

      public void SingleSelectDropDownBasedonIndex(java.lang.String inputtext,
                                             java.lang.String fieldname,
                                             int indexnumber)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
      Method used to work with single select dropdown based on index
      Parameters:
      inputtext - Value which needs to be selected in the dropdown
      fieldname - dropdown field name where the user needs to select a value - (Note: If the user doesn't want to select the dropdown value based on field name, he can set "false" as a field name parameter)
      indexnumber - Index number of the dropdown - (Note: If the field name is set as false then count the dropdown index by considering all the dropdown fields available in the UI OR In case of having field name as parameter, count the index number based on the dropdown field name) - (For Example:public void SingleSelectDropDownBasedonIndex("USA","Country",1) OR public void SingleSelectDropDownBasedonIndex("USA","false",3))
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - This exception will be thrown, if an error occurs while selecting a value from the dropdown based on index

    • SingleFilterValidation

      public void SingleFilterValidation()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
      Method used to validate the single filter data with the grid. By default it will take the first column name and its value for filter condition. This method will work only when the first column name will be in the filter condition - (Note: Filter needs to be a text or picker field and also first column name and filter name should be same)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - This exception will be thrown, if an error occurs while doing single filter data validation

    • DoubleFilterValidation

      public void DoubleFilterValidation()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
      Method used to validate the double filter data with the grid. By default it will take the first and second column's name and its value's for filter condition. This method will work only when the first and second column name's will be in the filter condition - (Note: First filter needs to be a text or picker field and second filter can be any fields and also first and second column name's and filter name's should be same)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - This exception will be thrown, if an error occurs while doing double filter data validation

    • public void ValidateResponseBodyasArrayinJSONArray(java.lang.String endpoint,
                                                   java.lang.String uniquearraykey,
                                                   java.lang.String uniquearrayvalue,
                                                   java.lang.String uniquearrayvaluetype,
                                                   java.lang.String fieldname,
                                                   java.lang.String arrayfieldname,
                                                   java.lang.String arrayfieldvalue,
                                                   java.lang.String arrayfieldevaluetype)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
      Method used to validate JSON array in the response body
      Parameters:
      endpoint - End point for which the response body needs to be validated
      uniquearraykey - Unique key in the JSON array
      uniquearrayvalue - Unique value in the JSON array
      uniquearrayvaluetype - Unique value type in the JSON array
      fieldname - Field name of the JSON value - Note: In case of complicated field names in the JSON separate it by comma to travel into the JSON
      arrayfieldname - field name of the JSON array which needs to be validated - Note: In case of checking multiple field names separate it by comma
      arrayfieldvalue - field value of the JSON array which needs to be validated - Note: In case of checking multiple field values separate it by comma
      arrayfieldevaluetype - field type of the JSON array which needs to be validated - Note: In case of checking multiple field values type separate it by comma - (For Example: public void ValidateResponseBodyasArrayinJSONArray("https://reqres.in/api/users?page=2","type","home","String","phoneNumbers","type,number","home,212 555-1234","string,string"))
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - This exception will be thrown, if an error occurs while validating JSON array in the response body

      token - Bearer token for the end point
      endpoint - End point for which the response body needs to be validated
      header - Content header which needs to be validated - (For Example: public void ValidateContentTypeforEndpointwithBearerToken("assesgrsgdrgsefwewrew","https://reqres.in/api/users?page=2","application/json"))
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - This exception will be thrown, if an error occurs while validating the content type for an end point with bearer token

    • PostRequest

                        java.lang.String Value,
                        java.lang.String endpoint)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
      Method used to post a request
      Parameters:
      Key - JSON key which needs to be posted - (Note: In case of multiple values, Please add it with comma separation.)

    Browser Methods:

    • StartDriver

      public void StartDriver(java.lang.String Browser,
                        java.lang.String HeadlessMode)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
      Method used for initiating the browser to run the automation scripts
      Parameters:
      Browser - Name of the browser from where the user wants to run the test case
      HeadlessMode - Mode of the browser run - (For Example: public void StartDriver("Chrome","Yes")) - (Note: By default, Starting a driver will be taken care by the framework so user do not need to use it)
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - This exception will be thrown, if an error occurs while starting a driver

    • OpenURL

      public void OpenURL(java.lang.String URL)
             throws java.lang.Exception
      Method used to open the Application URL
      Parameters:
      URL - The Application URL which needs to be opened - (For Example: public void OpenURL("www.google.com"))
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - This exception will be thrown, if an error occurs while opening the URL

                throws java.lang.Exception

      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - This exception will be thrown, if an error occurs while quitting the browser - (Note: By default, Quitting a driver will be taken care by the framework so user do not need to use it)
